etymology.description: 彳(彳) (chì, "walking") + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") = travel far -> 㢟 extended with a top stroke to indicate prolonged usage
etymology.interpretation: 延(yán, "prolong") originally depicted walking far, symbolizing distance or extension. The addition of a distinguishing stroke made it an ideogram, emphasizing the sense of prolongation.

examples.chinese: 假期因坏天气而被延长(假期因壞天氣而被延長)。
examples.pinyin: Jiàqī yīn huài tiānqì ér bèi yáncháng.
examples.english: The holiday was prolonged due to bad weather.

examples.chinese: 我们希望能延长比赛时间(我們希望能延長比賽時間)，以便让更多人参与(以便讓更多人參與)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xīwàng néng yáncháng bǐsài shíjiān, yǐbiàn ràng gèng duō rén cānyù.
examples.english: We hope to extend the game time so that more people can participate.

examples.chinese: 医生建议延缓手术(醫生建議延緩手術)。
examples.english: The doctor recommended postponing the surgery.
